resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

cyb70289 commented on PR #13473:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13473#issuecomment-1171953540

   Can I test the two jobs on my local arm64 machine?

kou commented on PR #13473:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13473#issuecomment-1171957271

   Yes. Here are command lines of them:
   
   ```console
   $ cd dev/tasks/linux-packages/apache-arrow
   $ gem install apt-dists-merge
   $ rake yum:build BUILD_DIR=build YUM_TARGETS=amazon-linux-2-aarch64
   $ rake yum:build BUILD_DIR=build YUM_TARGETS=centos-7-aarch64
   ```
   
   Note that you need to install Ruby. You can install Ruby by `apt install ruby rake` on Debian/Ubuntu.
   
   I'm also running these jobs on local amd64 machine with QEMU.

cyb70289 commented on PR #13473:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13473#issuecomment-1172060827

   Looks xsimd failed to build with gcc4.8.5. Is it necessary to make it work with gcc4.8?
   
   ```
   ../src/arrow/util/utf8.h:244:22: error: expected type-specifier
      using simd_batch = xsimd::make_sized_batch_t<int8_t, 16>;
                         ^
   ```

kou commented on PR #13473:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13473#issuecomment-1172128141

   Hmm, is it OK that we disable SIMD for CentOS 7 and aarch64?
   
   We can use newer g++ on CentOS 7 by devtoolset but it may cause a `libc++.so` version related problem...

cyb70289 commented on PR #13473:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13473#issuecomment-1172134062

   > Hmm, is it OK that we disable SIMD for CentOS 7 and aarch64?
   
   I think it's OK.

kou commented on PR #13473:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13473#issuecomment-1172210412

   OK. I'll disable SIMD on CentOS 7 aarch64.

kou commented on PR #13473:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13473#issuecomment-1172705696

   https://app.travis-ci.com/github/ursacomputing/crossbow/builds/252684277#L4242
   
   ```text
   /root/rpmbuild/BUILD/apache-arrow-9.0.0.dev305/cpp/src/arrow/compute/kernels/codegen_internal.h:314:25: internal compiler error: in expand_shift_1, at expmed.c:2245
   ```
   
   [Bug 72738](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=72738) - internal compiler error: in expand_shift_1, at expmed.c:2318
   
   > Fixed for GCC 7 by [r7-3897](https://gcc.gnu.org/cgi-bin/gcc-gitref.cgi?r=r7-3897).
   
   We need to use GCC 7 or later to support CentOS 7 aarch64. So I give up to enable CentOS 7 aarch64.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
{code:bash}
$ TEST_DEFAULT=0 TEST_YUM=1 dev/release/verify-release-candidate.sh 8.0.0 3
......
+ yum install -y --enablerepo=epel arrow-devel-8.0.0
Loaded plugins: ovl, priorities
193 packages excluded due to repository priority protections
No package arrow-devel-8.0.0 available.
Error: Nothing to do
Failed to verify the Yum repository for amazonlinux:2
{code}
fields.summary: [Dev] TEST_YUM=1 verify-release-candidate.sh fails on Arm host

comments.body:
Ah, we didn't build packages for aarch64 Amazon Linux 2.
I'll add support for aarch64 Amazon Linux 2 and CentOS 7 later.
